techmeme.title: YC-backed PearAI criticized for forking another AI code editor covered under the Apache license and changing the license to its own made-up closed license (Julie Bort/TechCrunch)
A US court awards Amazon a partial dismissal of FTC's lawsuit accusing it of illegal monopolies, in a sealed ruling whose details weren't immediately clear (Jody Godoy/Reuters)
Apple asks a judge to throw out or narrow an App Store anti-steering injunction, saying rulings in two unrelated cases undermine an order Epic won in its suit (Mike Scarcella/Reuters)
MIT spinoff Liquid AI debuts its non-transformer AI models LFM 1B, 3B, and 40B MoE, and claims they achieve "state-of-the-art performance at every scale" (Carl Franzen/VentureBeat)
Filing: UAE-based G42 accounted for 87% of Cerebras' H1 2024 revenue and has committed to buy $335M worth of its stock by April 2025, giving G42 a 5%+ stake (New York Times)
